page.title: 18Heaton suburb of Newcastle
page.content: East of the Ouseburn valley lies Heaton, Victorian housing grading in size from the edge of Armstrong Park on Heaton Road, East to the small terraces by the railway yard: a classic{Hoyt}urban transect also repeated elsewhere in Newcastle. On Heaton Road is a small colonial concentration, mainly professional occupations. Further east many of the houses are the traditional and widespread{Tyneside Flats;}two front doors, one flat on each floor, the top flat having outside steps to a yard and a back lane. Many are now owner occupied and an extensive{renovation} scheme operates. The older Byker (S) end underwent earlier clearance with medium rise{rebuilding,}and more tenant occupation. The transect no longer reflects the character of the population.
